WINDSOR AND HEALDSBURG ARE STILL EVACUATED! Do not attempt to drive around the cones! Do not line up at the off-ramp to talk to the officer! We can’t have a line of cars stopped on the freeway.
The freeway is open in both directions but the off-ramps are still closed from Airport Blvd to Dry Creek as those areas are still under mandatory evacuation. #kincadefires
US 101 is open in both directions. Please use caution for potential emergency personal and do not go around traffic cones. They are there for your protection. Stay safe. #SonomaStrong
Due to the uncertain conditions of fire behavior and heavy smoke in the Windsor area, US-101 remains closed from from Airport Blvd to Dry Creek Rd. #KincadeFirepic.twitter.com/G22TCL5gDM

US-101 is closed in the Windsor/Healdsburg area due to poor visibility and fire to the east of Arata Ln. The closure will begin in the northbound direction at Airport Blvd and on the southbound side at Dry Creek. Please avoid the area.
US-101 is open in both directions! Thank you for your patience and drive safe. #KincadeFirepic.twitter.com/tcVv1r3ZzV
We will do everything possible to keep US-101 open but there is a plan in place for tonight into tomorrow morning if a closure becomes necessary.

Healdsburg and Windsor are under mandatory evacuation for the #KincadeFire. We want everyone heading to a safe location by 4pm. This will give us all time to evacuate during daylight hours and before the #PSPS goes into effect. US-101 remains open at this time.
